Name: Trident
Ingredients: 30 ml Cynar or other carciofo amaro
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Bone dry and boozy, this cocktail is aimed at those who have a penchant for both sherry and aquavit, not to mention bittersweet artichoke liqueurs - hardly mass market then. Nor are Aston Martin cars but I want one. Be warned - use the wrong sherry and this drink falls apart - don't be tempted to sub manzanilla with a fino.
History: Robert Hess created this riff on a Negroni in 2002. The Trident name apparently was inspired by the fact that each of the three main ingredients comes from a different seafaring country.
Nutrition: One serving of Trident contains 146 calories
